title: How to completely reload Firefox and not lose passwords and maybe even settings.
content:
Firefox seems to be hanging up my computer every once and awhile. Why I think FF, if I am able to kill it with task manager- all is well. Prior to that system is pretrty much locked up, sometimes can't even get task manager running. Also, about twice a week I get a message from FF about oops your Foxnews tab has stopped., please send report. I haven't sent report, just do a reload.

I have run 3 virus checkers, chkdsk and sfc /scannow and all are okay no virus, disk or system files missing.

Thinking of switching browsers for awhile?? Then seems there is a place in profile that has passwords, but I forgot where. Maybe I could download a completely new copy of firefox and keep my profile?? Then again maybe my profile is messed up.

Any suggestions the best way to get a completely new copy of FF??

On Windows 10 current release and now FF 119.0. Down to using Flagfox, Malwarebytes Browser Guard, tab reloader, undo close tab, web threat shield (webroot). Was for years using Noscripts, but stopped it for the last few weeks. Actually I stopped Malwarebytes Browser Guard, web threat shield and noscripts and still got hung up. That only left Flagfox, undo close tab and tab reload running as addons.
creator: diverjer

title: Firefox closing at random with no crash report
content:
duplicate of /questions/1432058 thread.

Yesterday Firefox started closing at random, sometimes instantly as soon as I open it. The crash dialog doesn't open, and if I go to about:crashes my most recent unreported crash is from 2019. Tried refreshing, reinstalling, completely wiping all profiles and starting fresh. If I use troubleshooting mode it won't open properly at allI am at a bit of a loss, any ideas?
creator: nathanbee354

title: Firefox closing at random with no crash report
content: Yesterday Firefox started closing at random, sometimes instantly as soon as I open it. The crash dialog doesn't open, and if I go to about:crashes my most recent unreported crash is from 2019. Tried refreshing, reinstalling, completely wiping all profiles and starting fresh. If I use troubleshooting mode it won't open properly at all. I am at a bit of a loss, any ideas?
creator: nathanbee354

title: Ícono do Firefox não aparece na barra de tarefas
content:
Estou certo que o problema não é no Firefox, pois o mesmo problema ocorre em outras aplicações como Putty e Notepad++. No entanto com WinSCP e outros os problema não aparece.

Estou usando o Windows 11 versão 23H2 (Compilação do Sistema Operacional 22635.2771) e antes mesmo dessa versão isso já ocorria.

Desinstalei o Firefox, apaguei todos os registros "Mozilla" e "Firefox" dos diretórios %APPDATA%\Roaming, %APPDATA%\Local e %APPDATA%\LocalLow. Passei CCleaner, "Limpeza de Disco" do Windows para "Limpar arquivos de sistemas"

E nada, continua sem aparecer! ;-(
creator: luidisl
